author: ogenev
content: I guess a lightclient needs only `LightClientBootstrap`, `LightClientUpdate`,  latest `LightClientFinalityUpdate` and latest `LightClientOptimisticUpdate` data objects. You can use Req/Resp or/and  libp2p `light_client_finality_update` and `light_client_optimistic_update` topics to get those, depending on what networking layer you want to use.

author: enriavil1
content:
I am looking at goodBye message here: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/p2p-interface.md#status
I am wondering what does it mean that [4:127] are reserved? Does it mean that the uint64 request is from [128:]?

author: enriavil1
content: since I check the first 8 bytes and I get a huge number: 7011668113700093704

author: nishant0
content: It just means that the values from 4 to 127 cannot be assigned by clients for any specific error. It is reserved by the protocol for future uses

author: nishant0
content:
> I am wondering what does it mean that [4:127] are reserved? Does it mean that the uint64 request is from [128:]?

`uint64` will all be 8 bytes, so this doesn't change. We don't split out the response

author: enriavil1
content: oh okay I thought it was talking about bytes just realised it is actually talking about uint64 thank you
